info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 10:56PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Litchfield, Berkshire, northeastern Ulster, northeastern Dutchess, southern Columbia and southeastern Greene Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1056 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pittsfield to near Philmont to near Milton. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Torrington, Great Barrington, Saugerties, New Hartford, Claverack, Lee, Lenox, Amenia, Livingston, Copake, Sheffield, Kent, Sharon, Pine Plains, Clermont, Red Hook, Becket, Norfolk and Austerlitz. People attending Tanglewood should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 87 near exit 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
